titleInfo.title: The Childcare Handbook: Needs, Programs & Possibilities

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This document explains the Comprehensive Child Development Act of 1971, which was vetoed by President Richard Nixon. Part I, "Who Needs Child Care," documents a range of pressing social and economic forces and everyday personal crises that contribute to a growing majority of families' being likely to need child care services at some point to help them stay intact. Part II, "Program Profiles," highlights several model child care programs such as the After School Day Care Association, Inc. in Madison, Wisconsin; the A.P. Beutel II Day Care Center in Freeport, TX; and the Child Care Resource and Referral, Inc. in Rochester, Minnesota. Part III draws further upon the accumulated experience of workshop participants to spell out what advocates can do in both immediate and the longer range to protect and expand existing local and national child care programs that are working.
